Authors:
Juan S. Chirivi-Salomon, Giovanna Danies, Silvia Restrepo,
Tatiana I Sanjuan
Title:
Lecanicillium sabanense sp. nov. (Cordycipitaceae) a new
fungal entomopathogen of coccids
Abstract:
A new species of Lecanicillium was found associated with
the soft scale insect Pulvinaria caballeroramosae (Coccidae), an
important pest of Ficus soatensis (Moraceae) in BogotÃ¡, Colombia.
Lecanicillium sabanerum sp. nov. differs from similar Lecanicillium spp.
mainly in the size of the conidia, in the vertical arrangement of
phialides on the host, and in the tomentose mycelium that sparsely
covers the cuticle of the host. Phylogenetic analyses using the nuclear
sequences ITS1, SSU, LSU, TEF, RPB1, and RPB2 also confirmed the
distinctiveness of this new species. Fungal epizootics were found on
female soft scale insects, which may have important implications for
inclusion and establishment of biological control parameters in the
forestry program of the city. The ecology of the fungus as well as its
potential use as a biological control agent are further discussed.
